title.narrative: WITNESS - Using Video and Technology to Protect and Promote Human Rights in Africa, 2021-2022

description.narrative:
The grant supports the WITNESS project Using Video and Technology to Protect and Promote Human Rights Across Africa.
The primary stated objective of the project is: To ensure that the millions of vulnerable and marginalized communities affected by human rights violations turning to video and technology to defend their rights across Africa can do so safely and effectively.

WITNESS - Using Video and Technology to Protect and Promote Human Rights in Africa, 2021-2022 - • Increase knowledge and capacity of critical grassroots actors across Africa (e.g. vulnerable communies, rights defenders, activists, journalists) to utilize video and technology to combat discrimination and exclusion, hold the powerful to account, and inform decision-making on issues that affect them in their communities • Enhance responsiveness and action by systems-level actors (e.g. technology companies, lawyers, investigators, international justice stakeholders) to the needs and rights of marginalized groups across Africa when developing platforms, products, laws, and policies related civic space and digital resilience
